name: The Royal Lion Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at the Royal Lion Hotel in Lyme Regis Saturday 29th September in Room 6. I chose the hotel because of its location and historical significance and at £75 I was expecting to be a little bit impressed. Room 6 was a very small room at the very back of the hotel away the historical part of the bulding. It was on the ground floor with very little light and the bathroom was very cramped and uncomfortable. I feel that, as a solo traveller, there are many B&Bs in Lyme Regis that give you much better surroundings and charge less (and are friendlier). I was also treated very rudely by a barman for having the 'cheek' to order a latte at the bar 15 minutes after closing time. Even when I explained I was a resident he just looked at me coldly and said "bar's closed". This is far removed from the comment on the back of the hotel brochure which declares "You won't get a better welcome". The barman's nastiness coloured my whole expererience of staying at the hotel. I will not be going back!
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the royal lion 20/9/12 room was very nice but paying £155 a night would expect that BUT breackfast in morning was a disgrace we were greeted as we arrived in dining room with the head waiter just pointing to a table no good morning or a smile after 15 mins we asked if we good order a cup of tea but was told we would have to wait for the head waiter we waited 50mins to be served and then was served with half raw egg on my hushbands plate and mine not what i ordered we gave up and walked out and had to go to the cafe down the road. What made this worse was managment attude to are complaint we had to go back to them twice to find out why we had to put up with this and even then was not told why they could not cope, and was told on leaving that they would take £20 off bill like they were doing us a favour, we had booked this for a special treet for our selfs and this ruined it, I asked for the managers e mail address but was refused and told to e mail them, what is the use in this as i dont think half of the complaints get to the manager, managerment attude spoit this hoilday . Mrs Burke
reviews.title: we waited for 50 mins for breackfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On another wet August UK Saturday we were trudging the streets and seafront of Lyme Regis.
reviews.title: Shelter From Storm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A huge rain cloud had sent everyone scurring for cover and somewhere to eat. We chanced upon the Royal and while not our usual looking "port of call" we dived in and found a nice table in a warm cosy lounge. We ordered simple bar snacks (baggetts and chips) and a pint of the excellent Otter Bitter and a glass of rose for the boss.
reviews.title: Nice but a bit pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food came out in good time and was very good. In fact it was a very pleasant way of spending a short break. Good friendly service, good quality F&D and not too expensive. In fact if we were ever return to LR again (which would not be in August) we would consider staying here and perhaps search out the French Lieutenants Woman!
reviews.title: Give my regards to Broad Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has been our 2nd visit to Lyme Regis and the Royal Lion Hotel this year. We were given a lovely, tastefully decorated balcony room overlooking the sea on our first overnight visit in March 2012. We were delighted with the friendliness of staff, high standards of service and cuisine and overall cleanliness of the hotel. Being able to leave the car in a safe carpark whilst we explored the area was a real bonus. You may recall, March was our "early summer" and the town was quiet and peaceful.
reviews.title: Our 2nd visit this year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our most recent visit in August found us staying overnight in The King Edward Suite, overlooking the main street. The room and decor were very different to that of the Balcony rooms, but non the less equally pleasing having a great historical charm.
reviews.title: Full of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delighted to say that the reception we received this time was equally pleasing, room spotless, cuisine of a high standard and staff polite and courteous. I would have no hesitation in recommending this charming 17th Centuary Coaching Inn to anyone who wants old world charm, with modern comforts and a breath of Sea Air.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Royal Lion is a lovely hotel in keeping with the character of Lyme Regis. Nice choice of rooms, beautiful swimming pool etc. Lyme Regis is indeed the pearl of Dorset and located in the centre of town but close to the seafront, the Royal Lion a very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Good location, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with our room, it was very spacious and spotlessly clean,bathroom was also very spacious, although it faced the road outside, that did not bother us, stayed in lots of hotels but this was the best room we have had in a long while! Staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel had a nice cosy atmosphere. Breakfast was good, Cant complain about anything. Great location couldnt have been any more convenient.
reviews.title: Fabulous Lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last month we stayed at the Royal Lion hotel. We loved the town but the service at breakfast in the hotel was deplorable! Having ordered our breakfast in the dining room, three times I had to speak to the head waitress as we were waiting so long. I then noticed that THREE tables who arrived after us were served before us. This issue I also brought to the attention of the head waitress. It was ONE HOUR before we were finally served. Needless to say, we will not be returning to The Royal Lion.
reviews.title: How long does it take to cook breakfast?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a pleasant stay last weekend. Certainly cosy and friendly place to stay in the lovely but increasingly expensive Lyme Regis. Been coming for many years, some of the B&B are so expensive that the Hotel is quite competitive in price these days.
reviews.title: Could do a bit better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room was comfy, bed very comfy, carpets stained and dull. The en suite was large, far from luxurious and the shower terrible in terms of pressure.
reviews.title: Fabulous return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good nights sleep, nice and quiet. Breakfast was ok, rather than memorable. My understanding of 'eggs' is that there should be more than one! Didnt have dinner although I have heard good reports.
reviews.title: Lovely bar... rooms not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Overall a good experience but could really do with some attention to detail to lift it into the 4* range. Could be really lovely and an absolute goldmine given the location.
reviews.title: Overpriced 3* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a delightful hotel with a really relaxing ambience. Lovely updated rooms and lots of recreation facilities. We had a room overlooking the quaint High Street which we felt was great value for money, we have paid much more and got a great deal less in the accommodation stakes. We also moved and had a balcony view room for a portion of our stay. These have lovely side sea views and are lovely places to spend time just relaxing with a good book and letting the sea breeze float over you.
reviews.title: Lovlely Relaxing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located for the Promenade and shops, some of which are quite quirky and unusual.
reviews.title: Great family friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We ate in the oak room on our first evening and whilst we enjoyed the food the ambience was a little stilted for our taste. The staff was excellent and very attentive. On the second evening we ate in the bar area and we really enjoyed the food and ambience, friendly staff and a roaring log fire added to the overall feel good factor. The lounges across from the bar are fabulous places to chill out in both in the day time and before and after dinner. The sofas are really squishy and so comfortable after a long day sight seeing. We were always very happy to sink into them with a pre dinner drink and a good book. All in all this is a great place for a real chill out weekend, good location, good food, and comfort. We will be back.
reviews.title: An excellent couple of days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a terrific couple of days in lyme despite the weather in the last week of October 2012. This was a welcome contrast to the glitzy plastic hotel I was in the previous week in Las Vegas The hotel was a great find, the staff were friendly, bedrooms comfortable, we had a balcony room which was a good choice, my son was at the front in a standard room which ŵas comfortable but a bit noisy in the morning. the breakfasts were well prepared and top quality. We ate the from the bar menu which was wholesome and good value. We did not use the pool but it looked clean and the availability of towels were I can't do hills so the location close to the seafront was perfect for me to get to the promenade and back.
reviews.title: Good hotel, excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for two nights with friends on 29/30 Oct 12 and we all enjoyed our stay very much. All staff were professional, friendly and helpful; always with a smile. The food was excellent with a very interesting menu that changed on each day (hang on to that chef). The hotel is clean and comfortable and we will be staying there again.
reviews.title: Lovely early autumn break

description: At the heart of the idyllic town of Lyme Regis, 'the Pearl of Dorset', is the Royal Lion Hotel, a stunning haven located in the middle of the High Street, with its own private car park. Lyme Regis is a picturesque town on the West Dorset border, part of the Jurassic Coast, a World Heritage site. Steeped in history, it is renowned for its fascinating past, mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086, the unique fossils found in the cliffs and beaches, and for being the central location of the novel and the 1981 film, 'The French Lieutenant's Woman'. Situated less than 100 metres from the sea, the Royal Lion Hotel is a perfect base from which to explore the locale. Built in 1601 as a coaching inn, the Hotel has been extensively refurbished, yet still retains much of its history and unique charm. Oak beams, wood panelling and open fires help to create a warm, welcoming and comfortable atmosphere, with new additions of its own swimming pool and other facilities. Wi-Fi, although not available in the bedrooms, is available to guests in several areas of the hotel. Privately owned and managed, the Royal Lion Hotel has gained an enviable reputation for its friendly service, world class food and wine and leisure offerings.
